eshmun.structures.skeletons

Class FromSkeletonConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.structures.skeletons.FromSkeletonConverter

  • public class FromSkeletonConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for converting a synch. skeleton to a Kripke structure (single or multi).
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab

    • Field Detail

      • definition

        private java.lang.String definition
        The resulting structure definition.

      • states

        private java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonState> states
        List of the state of the skeletons to convert. Each state contains its out-going and in-coming edges/transitions.

      • processes

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processes
        The participating processes in the list.

      • process2Start

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonState>> process2Start
        A map from process names to a list of start skeleton states.

        Base name for the structure(s).

    • Constructor Detail

      • FromSkeletonConverter

        public FromSkeletonConverter(java.lang.String name,
                             java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonState> states)
        Construct a new converter for the given skeleton.
        Parameters:
        name - the base name of the resulting Kripke structure.
        states - a list of the skeletons' states.

    • Method Detail

      • convertToMultipKripke

        public boolean convertToMultipKripke()
        Convert to Multi-Kripke.
        Returns:
        true if conversion was successful. false otherwise (error).

      • convertToSingleKripke

        public boolean convertToSingleKripke()
        Convert to Single-Kripke.
        Returns:
        true if conversion was successful. false otherwise (error).

      • generateKripkeDefinition

        private java.lang.String generateKripkeDefinition(java.lang.String name,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processes)
        Generates an equivalent single Kripke Structure for the given States in a Skeleton.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the generated structure.
        processes - a sorted list of processes participating in the resulting structure.
        Returns:
        the structure definition.

      • handleSkelTransition

        private java.util.ArrayList<FromSkeletonConverter.StoredTransition> handleSkelTransition(SkeletonTransition transition,
                                                                                         java.lang.String[] currentKripkeLabels,

      • restrictProcesses

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonState>> restrictProcesses(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> processes)
        Restricts the mapping from all process to their skeletons' start state, to a mapping of the given processes only.
        Parameters:
        processes - the processes to restrict the mapping to.
        Returns:
        a list, each element is a list of start states for the process that matches its index in the given processes list.

      • crossProduct

        private <T> java.util.ArrayList<T[]> crossProduct(java.util.Collection<? extends java.util.Collection<? extends T>> collections)
        Computes the cross product between n collections.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements in the original collections.
        Parameters:
        collections - a collection of the collection for which to compute cross product.
        Returns:
        a list of combination, each combination is an arry of elements; where the first element belongs to the first collection, the second element belong to the second collection, and so on.

      • createConsistentSkeletonName

        private java.lang.String createConsistentSkeletonName(SkeletonState state)
        Get a consistent label / name for the given state. The state could be made from multiple proposition. The consistent name is their sorted join by ',' .
        Parameters:
        state - the state to get the label/name for.
        Returns:
        the consistent label/name.

      • createConsistentKripkeLabel

        private java.lang.String createConsistentKripkeLabel(SkeletonState[] states)
        Create a label for the given global state. The label will be consistent. It is assumed that the given list is sorted by process indices. I.e. the smallest process' state comes first. Note that in the resulting label: a semi-comma separates different processes labels, while a comma separates different labels for the same process.
        Parameters:
        states - a list of skeleton (local) states sorted by their processes.
        Returns:
        a consistent label that combines the state of all the processes.

      • join

        private static java.lang.String join(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> strs,
                                     java.lang.String sep)
        Joins a collection of strings into one string.
        Parameters:
        strs - the collection.
        sep - the separator.
        Returns:
        a joined string.

      • join

        private static java.lang.String join(java.lang.String[] strs,
                                     java.lang.String sep)
        Joins an array of strings into one string.
        Parameters:
        strs - the array.
        sep - the separator.
        Returns:
        a joined string.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the converter internally to be ready to convert (the same given skeleton) again.

      • getStructureDefinition

        public java.lang.String getStructureDefinition()
        Returns:
        the resulting structure definition from the last conversion attempted, null if no conversion was attempted since construction or last reset.
